title: Quadratic Applications & Modeling
description: Apply quadratic functions to solve real-world problems in business, physics, and engineering with Ghana-focused scenarios.
subject: Mathematics
achievementDescription: Successfully model and solve complex real-world problems using quadratic functions

text.introduction: Quadratic functions model many real-world situations where relationships involve squared terms. From the trajectory of projectiles to profit maximization in business, quadratics help us understand and optimize various phenomena. Learning to translate word problems into mathematical models is a crucial skill for problem-solving.

sections.title: Projectile Motion Problems
sections.content:
**General Form:** h(t) = -gt²/2 + v₀t + h₀
Where:
• h(t) = height at time t
• g = acceleration due to gravity (≈ 9.8 m/s²)
• v₀ = initial velocity
• h₀ = initial height

**Key Questions:**
• When does the object hit the ground? (h = 0)
• What is the maximum height? (find vertex)
• When does it reach maximum height?

**Example:** A ball is thrown upward from 2m height with initial velocity 15 m/s
• h(t) = -4.9t² + 15t + 2
• Maximum height: t = -15/(2×-4.9) = 1.53s
• h(1.53) = 13.5m

sections.title: Area and Optimization Problems
sections.content:
**Common Scenarios:**
• Maximizing area with fixed perimeter
• Minimizing perimeter with fixed area
• Finding optimal dimensions

**Problem-Solving Steps:**
1. Define variables clearly
2. Write constraint equation
3. Express what you're optimizing
4. Substitute to get one variable
5. Find vertex of resulting quadratic

**Example:** Rectangle with perimeter 40m
• If width = x, then length = 20 - x
• Area = x(20 - x) = 20x - x²
• Maximum when x = 10m (square gives max area)

sections.title: Business Revenue Problems
sections.content:
**Revenue Model:** R = price × quantity = p × q

Often: q = linear function of p
So: R = quadratic function of p

**Typical Problem:** As price increases, fewer items sell
• q = a - bp (demand decreases with price)
• R = p(a - bp) = ap - bp²
• Maximum revenue at p = a/(2b)

**Ghana Example:** Kenkey vendor
• Daily sales: q = 100 - 10p (cedis)
• Revenue: R = p(100 - 10p) = 100p - 10p²
• Optimal price: p = 5 cedis

sections.title: Problem-Solving Strategy
sections.content:
**The UNDERSTAND Method:**

**U**nderstand what you're asked to find
**N**ame your variables
**D**raw a diagram if helpful
**E**stablish relationships and constraints
**R**ecognize the quadratic model
**S**olve the equation or find the vertex
**T**est your answer for reasonableness
**A**nswer the original question clearly
**N**ote any limitations or assumptions
**D**ouble-check your work

questions.question: A ball is thrown upward with equation h(t) = -5t² + 20t + 3. When does it hit the ground?
questions.explanation: Set h(t) = 0: -5t² + 20t + 3 = 0. Using quadratic formula: t = (20 ± √(400 + 60))/10 ≈ 4.14s (taking positive root).

questions.question: For revenue R = 50p - 2p², what price gives maximum revenue?
questions.explanation: For R = -2p² + 50p, maximum occurs at p = -50/(2×-2) = 12.5.

exercises.title: Ghana Context Problems
exercises.instructions: Create mathematical models for these Ghana-based scenarios and solve using quadratic methods.
exercises.hint: Focus on identifying what you're trying to optimize and what constraints you have.

exercises.title: Business Applications
exercises.instructions: Help Ghanaian businesses optimize their operations using quadratic modeling.
exercises.hint: Remember that maximum/minimum values occur at the vertex of parabolas.

scenarioChallenges.title: Ghana Mobile Money Business Optimization
scenarioChallenges.scenario: Akosua runs a mobile money business in Kumasi. She's noticed that her daily profit P (in cedis) depends on the transaction fee f she charges (in pesewas) according to: P(f) = -2f² + 180f - 1800. She needs to determine the optimal fee to charge and understand her business model better.
tasks: Find the transaction fee that maximizes daily profit
Calculate the maximum daily profit possible
If she must charge at least 30 pesewas per transaction due to operating costs, what's her optimal fee?
Create a recommendation report for Akosua
learningObjectives: Apply quadratic optimization to business scenarios
Interpret vertex and roots in business contexts
scenarioChallenges.ghanaContext: Mobile money services are extremely popular in Ghana, with many entrepreneurs running mobile money businesses that serve as financial access points for their communities.
